bibl.title: Letter, James L. Dodds in France, to Ellen Smith, in Jackson, Tenn., 1919 Mar. 30

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

revisionDesc.change: Approximate date of original transcription and transcriber.
Migrating from P4 to validated TEI P5.

div.p: J.L. Dodds
T Co # 8 = 23 Engir
Amer Exp Forces
Miss Ellen Smith
111 Hatton Street
Jackson
Tennessee
OM
Souilly France
March 30 1919
Dear Ellen:-
Althou I think this is a one sided affair I am going to write you this afternoon any way.
Another week has gone by and not a line from you
I wonder what is the matter with you
I hope you are not sick it has been over three
weeks since I heard from you.
Well one year ago tonite I left the good old U.S.A I stood out on the deck while I past the Statue of Liberty.
And wondered if I would ever get back to see her once more Well I am going to make it I believe I dont know when but I hope soon
you should be over here and enjoy this snow we are having has been snowing for a week
And it didnt stop for sunday either.
Lin left here last friday I sure did hate to see him leave for we visited one another pretty often
He was over to see me last monday
night to say good bye I told him when he got back home to tell you I was O.K.
I might get home before he does or might be later I havent any idea about it at all.
Thank maybe we will leave this camp some time in April
Most all the Amex Soldiers are gone from here now it left the 23 Engir
Ant the French are moving in so we will have to get out
Now if you have got married I thank you should write me about it
will quit for this time Hoping to hear from you soon as Ever
James L. Dodds
